header.bio: I am a 21-year-old undergraduate student at Virginia Tech, working toward my Bachelor's of Science in Computer Science, which I will complete as of May 2025. I currently work as a mobile software developer at SAIC in Alexandria, VA. I will be pursuing a Master's of Engineering in Computer Science with a focus on Software Engineering and Machine Learning, and will be graduating in the Spring of 2026 through Virginia Tech's (4+1) accelerated program.

about.title: About Me
about.description: Hello, I’m Nickolas Paraskevopoulos, a dedicated student at Virginia Tech, studying Computer Science within the College of Engineering. I am on track to graduate with my bachelor’s degree in the Spring of 2025 and will be pursuing a Master's of Engineering in Computer Science, with concentrations in Software Engineering and Machine Learning, and expect to graduate in the Spring of 2026. Driven by a passion for technology and a commitment to innovation, I consistently engage in personal development through technical projects in my free time, further enhancing my skills and knowledge outside of formal coursework. As a result of this, I have gained extensive hands-on experience while maintaining a strong GPA of 3.5. In my current role as a Mobile Software Developer and through two impactful internships, I’ve gained extensive experience in software development, contributing to real-world projects and honing my technical abilities. I am proficient in a wide range of programming languages including Java, C, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kotlin, SQL, HTML, CSS, and XML. My expertise in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming allows me to approach complex challenges with both creativity and precision. Additionally, I have a solid understanding of database management systems, working extensively with PostgreSQL, Supabase, and SQLite. I’m eager to continue applying my skills and knowledge as I further my education and contribute to the tech industry’s evolving landscape with innovation and enthusiasm.
